intro: Lantana costaricensis, commonly known as the Costarica lantana, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, brightly colored flowers that range from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are often borne in terminal inflorescences. Lantana costaricensis is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
